item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (194 points | 44 comments)
2. Learn You Some Erlang for Great Good (45 points | 10 comments)
3. Big LLMs weights are a piece of history (32 points | 13 comments)
4. Show HN: My high school team's space probe (70 points | 16 comments)
5. City simulator I made in Scratch (62 points | 3 comments)
6. Lynx is the oldest web browser still being maintained (144 points | 68 comments)
7. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (205 points | 61 comments)
8. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (423 points | 101 comments)
9. Styling an HTML dialog modal to take the full height of the viewport (9 points | 7 comments)
10. Lago (Open-Source Usage Based Billing)Is Hiring Sr Ruby Engineers (Latam) ( | hide)
11. Command A: Max performance, minimal compute – 256k context window (35 points | 6 comments)
12. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (268 points | 102 comments)
13. High-performance computing, with much less code (22 points | 2 comments)
14. Implications of Global Privacy Control (28 points | 16 comments)
15. Milk Kanban (391 points | 153 comments)
16. Male octopus injects female with venom during sex to avoid being eaten (4 points | 1 comment)

20. GPT 4.5 level for 1% of the price (225 points | 155 comments)
21. The British Nationality Act as a Prolog Program (1986) [pdf] (9 points | 1 comment)
22. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (103 points | 55 comments)
23. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (128 points | 68 comments)
24. Medicaid cuts could devastate elderly in Florida nursing homes (19 points | 7 comments)
25. Career Advice in 2025 (224 points | 120 comments)
26. DeepSeek focuses on research over revenue (118 points | 61 comments)
27. How many artists' careers did the Beatles kill? (182 points | 166 comments)
28. More pro for the DEC Professional 380 (featuring PRO/VENIX) (37 points | 4 comments)
29. Steam-powered piston system sparks nuclear fusion plasma in Canada (16 points | discuss)
30. Strengthening AI Agent Hijacking Evaluations (36 points | 11 comments)
